publicwhip.spmotion: * S2M-3084 Mr Kenny MacAskill: Peaceful Protestâ€”That the Parliament congratulates the organisers and support staff of the Make Poverty History march on 2 July 2005 for organising and hosting the event; thanks the police for doing an exemplary job and ensuring that the day passed without serious incident, and further thanks the estimated 225,000 participants for coming to Edinburgh to march together in peaceful protest against the scourge of world poverty. Supported by: Fiona Hyslop*, Michael McMahon*, Linda Fabiani*, Rob Gibson*, Susan Deacon*, Christine Grahame*, Mrs Margaret Ewing*, Nora Radcliffe*, Jim Mather*, Mike Pringle*, Des McNulty*, Tricia Marwick*, Jackie Baillie*, Chris Ballance*, Cathie Craigie*, Bruce Crawford*, Mr David Davidson*, Stewart Stevenson*, Dennis Canavan*, Mr John Swinney*, Brian Adam*, Richard Lochhead*, Shona Robison*, Alex Neil*, Shiona Baird*, Robin Harper*, Dr Jean Turner*, Eleanor Scott* Motions and amendments which have attracted additional support
S2M-3084 Peaceful Protest (lodged on 5 July 2005) Ms Sandra White*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Michael Matheson*, Patrick Harvie*, Donald Gorrie*
S2M-3084 Peaceful Protest (lodged on 5 July 2005) Mr Stewart Maxwell*
S2M-3084 Peaceful Protest (lodged on 5 July 2005) Karen Gillon*
